item.title: A failed glue experiment: Tear Mender
item.description:
I tried using a glue called Tear Mender in attempt to glue the elastic to the fabric before sewing it. Mistake.

It did not work the way I hoped. I seeped deep into the fabric and wouldn't set. Then it pilled and didn't look good. So, not this kind of glue.

I know, exciting post...

I wish I had more help.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Experiment using snaps instead of hook and eyes for the elastic
item.description:
Today, a friend had the materials for putting snaps on stuff so I tried making a gaff with snaps!

I was surprised. It went well, looked good, and functioned fine. For at least two hours of sitting and standing everything was fine.

I am definitely going to get some people to try this out. Especially those who have tried the hook and eye style already.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: New Construction Method Experiment
item.description:
So I had an epiphany about how to construct the gaff while making one for a new person. So I thought I'd try it out. I am impressed and can't wait to keep experimenting with this to prove it's a solid construction method.

I'm looking for a couple things:

  • Is is durable?
  • Does it provide the same level of tucking quality?
  • Does it take less time to construct?

Very quickly I can answer, it takes WAY less time to make. It took 55 minutes for me to make one of these panels. I went from 6 stitches to 1 stitch. Wow.

I am hopeful that the placement of the eye all the way up in the corner is a benefit, although that needs to be tested a bunch.

It appears the tuck is fine as well. However I am trying out new materials and it looks like I need to adjust my sizing for these other materials so they function perfectly.

More experiments with these fabrics coming soon!
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra
